newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real ends up 0.03 pct in nervous trade.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real ends up 0.03 pct in nervous trade.

text.p: Brazil's real rose 0.03 percent at the end of the session to close at 1.0187 per dollar after a day of nervous trade, dealers said.
The real hit 1.0206 per greenback, down 0.16 percent from Monday's close, due to market expectations of large dollar outflows today.
But outflows did not match expectations and the real recovered, dealers said.
In late afternoon, preliminary figures for commercial and financial foreign exchange contracts showed dollar flows were roughly balanced on Tuesday, they added.

Before the opening, the Central Bank set a weaker mini-band for the real at 1.018 to 1.023 per dollar, dealers said. The previous mini-band, set last Thursday, was between 1.017 and 1.022 reais to the dollar.
In the interbank forex floating rate market, the real closed at 1.0231 to the dollar, down 0.07 percent, after the Central Bank sold dollars at 1.0230 reais per greenback.
In the illegal parallel market, the real ended steady at 1.029 per greenback, traders said.
